If you want the URLs that you put in the description field to be clickable (they turn blue), then you must leave out the [img] tags, and include a couple of carriage returns between each URL instead.

Good quality if you don't want to download a 1080p 77 GB file. Including Elvish-only, English subs in MKV, rather than complete movie English subs, would have been appreciated (Uploader). A/V/subs: 10/10/4.


Elvish subs:

http://subscene.com/english/the-lord-of-the-rings-the-fellowship-of-the-ring-extended-edition/subtitle-447815.aspx

http://subscene.com/english/the-lord-of-the-rings-the-two-towers-extended-edition/subtitle-447817.aspx

http://subscene.com/english/the-lord-of-the-rings-the-return-of-the-king-extended-edition/subtitle-447818.aspx

â€¦also, Subs Girmi is suggesting are already in this MKV container. His recommendation is for entire movie subs, not Non-English parts only subs.

Dl'ers, download mkvtoolix (mkv merge) to add elvish-only (.SRT) subtitles suggested above) to MKV container, and delete or undefault English subs for entire movie. 

Open MKVmerge, "add" mkv movie file and corresponding .srt file downloaded from subscene. Click the elvish-only .SRT subtitle file under "tracks, chapters, and tags", change "default" to "yes" on "default track flag". Then change "default" to "no" on existing subtitles in file (if you want to get rid of them all together, merely uncheck them), unless hearing impaired and you need/want the entire movie in English subtitles, ignore this. Good luck

great on computer.
